summary: The Fair Access to Agriculture Disaster Programs Act aims to amend the Food Security Act of 1985. It proposes an exception to certain payment limitations for individuals or entities who derive a significant portion (75%) of their income from agricultural activities. This includes farming, ranching, silviculture, agritourism, direct-to-consumer marketing, and sales of agricultural equipment. The bill specifies that this exception applies to payments or benefits under specific existing agricultural programs.
